12 M Insp of Smoke Exhaust Fans Olympic Park

**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
2. Reference Manual, Fantech Pty Ltd. Olympic Park portal Centrifugal
Fans . Operations and
Maintenance manual. M STG-VE-26200.
WARNING:
HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN WHEN YOU ARE IN THE FAN
ENCLOSURE.
3. Check fan outlet stacks and protective mesh for build up of debris
that will inhibit outlet
damper operation use an extension ladder. (3m wall) in accordance
with work instruction TM1-3012-SA-0121 Ladders- Saf e inspect
and to clear any debris. [_ _]
4. Static Fan checks
Switch the fan AUTO/OFF/MANUAL switch to the OFF position, lock the
switch and tag, in
accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103, before proceeding with the
inspection.
(a) Check the safety guards and other safety features for safe
operating condition. [_ _]
(b) Check the flexible connection of the ducting for leaks, tearing
and fraying. [_ _]
(c) Check the grease in the fan bearings for quality, apply Shell
Stamina RL2 (or equivalent)
with a grease gun if required. Greasing can be safely
performed with fan either static or
running. Apply grease until new clean grease is exhausted from
the bearing. [_ _]
(d) Check the fan belts for wear and correct tension as per the O
&M Manual
M-STG-VE-26200. [_ _]
(e) Check the belt pulley for wear and alignment. Adjust if
required. [_ _]
(f ) Check that all fixings are secure. [_ _]
(g) Check for corrosion or deterioration in surface coatings. [_ _]
(h) Remove inspection covers and check fan internals for debris and
ingress of moisture.
Clean if necessary. [_ _]
5. Static Motor Checks.
Lock out the motor controls at switchboard, and tag, in accordance
with TMI-3012-SA-0103.
(a) Check that the motor is clear of accumulated dust on external
surfaces and that the
external ventilation airways are clear. [_ _]
(b) Carry out an insulation/resistance test of the motor and heater
windings.
(i) Ensure fan motor is isolated.
(ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor
Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans has been
isolated and is to remain
isolated.
(a) Disconnect neutral from the motor winding heater
(where connected) and
bridge heater terminals.
(b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor winding
terminals.
(iii) Carry out an Insulation resistance test between the motor
windings and the
winding heater bridge. Record the result in the ""Work
Done"" area.
(iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater
connections and carry out
an Insulation resistance test between this common bridge
and earth. Record
the result in the ""Work Done"" area.
(v) Remove all temporary connections.
(vi) Remove supply lines to the motor and carry out an
insulation resistance test
on the motor windings, Between phase winding to phase
winding and between
each phase winding and earth. Record results in the Work
Done area of the
Job sheet.
(vii) If the heater was connected on arrival, then re-instate
the heater connections,
otherwise leave the motor winding heater terminations
isolated.
(viii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion.
(x) Where any insulation resistance reading is less than 2
megohm, then Record
in the ""Work Done""area of the Job Sheet and raise a
new job for the outstanding
works. Include the Job Number of the new job in the
Related Job"" field as well
as in the alternate. Notify the Team Leader or his
representative of any
outstanding works.
CAUTION: DO NOT PERFORM AN INSULATION RESISTANCE TEST ON
MOTOR THERMAL PROTECTION DEVICES
(c) Check the motor starter, contacts and terminals where
appropriate. [_ _]
(d) Check the lubrication of motor bearings and apply Shell Stamina
RL2 grease with a
grease gun if required. Greasing can be safely performed
with the motor either static
or running. Apply the grease until new clean grease is
extruded from the
bearing. [_ _]
6. Fan Operation
CAUTION: ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS
REQUIRED
AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR.
CAUTION: DO NOT RUN MORE THAN 2 FANS AT ANY TIME.
CAUTION: A MINIMUM OF 4 INLET DAMPERS MUST BE OPEN BEFORE RUNNING
FANS.
(a) Notify the control room to open the tunnel smoke inlet dampers.
(b) Ensure all safety guards and inspection opening covers are in
place. [_ _]
(c) Remove tags and locks, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103, andremove
the
motor isolation. [_ _]
(d) Switch AUTO/OFF/MANUAL to MANUAL position and start each fan
using the
START/STOP/RESET pushbutton. Run each fan for 30 minutes.
(e) Check that the outlet damper opens fully. [_ _]
NOTE: The following checks shall be made using touch, sight
and hearing only.
Perceived problems will be referred for further
checks using instrumentation.
(f ) Check the fan bearings for uneven rumbling or hammering noise.
[_ _]
(g) Check fan bearings for overheating by holding hand on bearing
for 5 -10seconds. [_ _]
(h) Check fans for excessive vibration (surging or beating sound)
orshuddering on start
up or run down. [_ _]
(i) Check the ducting flexible connections are not overstressed due
to fan movement. [_ _]
(j) Check that the seismic mounts have free movement and are secure.
7. Motor checks
(a) Check the motor for noisy running and excessive vibration. [_ _]
(b) Check for excessive heating by holding hand on motor in bearing
areas for 5-10
seconds. [_ _]
(c) Measure and compare the motor current with the rated current.
FLC 125A
8. (a) On completion of checks switch the fan OFF using the
START/STOP/RESET pushbutton.
(b) Check that the outlet damper closes fully on shutdown. [_ _]
(c) Request the control room to close inlet smoke dampers. [_ _]
9. Reset the fan AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO position.
10. Ensure the fan station is clean and all accumulated debris and
rubbish is removed. [_ _]
11. Record any corrective action required, in the ""Work Done"" area of
the job sheet. [_ _]
12. On completion of the job notify the control room. [_ _]
